headline: Oven-Baked Baby Back Ribs
description: Chef John's oven-baked baby back ribs are seasoned with a homemade dry rub, then glazed with barbeque sauce and baked until tender and delicious. No grill required!

video.description: See how easy it is to make flavorful ribs in the oven.
video.name: How to Make Baked BBQ Baby Back Ribs

name: Oven-Baked Baby Back Ribs

recipeInstructions.text: Gather ingredients and preheat the oven to 250 degrees F (120 degrees C).
Mix ancho chile powder, white and brown sugars, salt, black pepper, cumin, dry mustard, cayenne, and chipotle pepper in a small bowl until combined.

Place rib rack, meat-side down, on heavy-duty aluminum foil. Prick back of the rack several times with a knife. Generously apply a coating of dry rub to all sides of the rack. Store any remaining dry rub in an airtight container for future use.
With the meat facing down, fold foil around the rack to create a tight seal. Transfer to a sheet pan.
Bake in the preheated oven until tender and cooked through, about 2 hours. Remove and cool 15 minutes.
Increase oven temperature to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Open foil, drain and discard any accumulated juices and fat. Brush barbeque sauce on all sides of the rack.

Turn the rack on the foil so the meat is facing up. Return to the oven, leaving the foil open and bake for 10 minutes. Remove from the oven and brush another layer of barbeque sauce on the meat side only. Repeat baking and brushing with sauce 4 more times, for a total of 50 minutes baking time.
Cut rack into individual rib segments and serve with more barbeque sauce.

review.reviewBody: I liked it. Easy to make. I think I over spiced with the rub, but we enjoyed it.
Excellent recipe which I followed step by step as is and you can tweak to your personal taste buds. I make my own dry rub (36 hrs. frig) and sauce. Thank You.
Girlfriend hated it and refused to eat it since it wasn't "fall off the bone". I thought it was okay but all food is okay to me
Absolutely fantastic taste from such an easy process.
Very easy, clean up was a breeze. I will be making ribs in the oven using this recipe. Thank you for sharing it!
Loved this and so did my picky family. I'm diabetic so I swapped out the sugars for friendly sugars. No one could tell, they gobbled it up. Making it again today.

Every time i added the BBQ sauce, it would lower the temp of the meat. I kept checking the temp and it wouldn't get high enough. After 40 minutes of basting and reinserting into a 350 oven, I said enough and cut into one. WAY OVERCOOKED.
Great tasting & easy to make. I do take the silver skin off the back of the ribs.
Great spices and the ribs fell off the bones.
Loved it. Making another one tonight.
Great recipe. You always have to take the white membrane off the back off any ribs you make. That stuff is nasty .
Did as directed Accidentally put 1/4 cup pepper in. Nice:)
I made this recipe so many times already, this is the best tasting back ribs I have ever tasted, hands down. It's tastier than the ribs you would have at the most famous barbecue restaurant.
Delicious. I Use this with a rack of St. Louis ribs and it was so good that I’ve made it again and again. Well worth your time, and save the rest of the rub for the next rack!
I did a variable of the recipe. I used brown sugar piled on. Put apple juice inside foil wrap. Followed the rest of cooking instructions. The ribs turned out perfectly.
Recipe was simple and easy to follow. My ribs were amazing!!! Family loved it. This recipe has been printed and bookmarked on all devices.

This is my first time successfully made a tasty back ribs. I used Pork Loin Back ribs and followed every steps of the directions. Thanks Chef John for your wonderful and once again easy recipes to follow. I have two more racks and plan to make them this weekend. Happy Labor's Day everyone! TA
Easy to do, and brings happy contented bellies oh and smiles
Easy and they were fantastic!
Really Good
It was delicious! Loved it.
I love this recipe. Perfect portions. I love it.
Cook them longer if you want them really tender. This dry rub goes a long way and is very salty. If you want a sweet finish I’d use the dry rub sparingly so you taste more of the bbq sauce.
My goodness! Tasty and tender. Added onion and garlic powder. Great!!!
Made this recipe for the first time and it turned out fantastic!! Definitely make this again.
Really good recipe , ribs were tender, used my own rub
We followed the recipe and loved the baby back ribs. This recipe is a winner! Deb
This recipe worked for a large cookout. Made 3 racks and did the last application of BBQ on the grill for that cookout effect.
Excellent recipe will make again!
GREAT !!!!!

Best ribs I've ever made. Better than on a grill because of the slow cook feature. Made the following adjustments for our palates - 1/2 the chile powder called for, 1/2 the cayenne, 1/2 the salt, 1/2 the cumin.
Excellent recipe! It's so good it is the only method we use for our ribs, even though we have a grill and pellet grill. Thank you, Chef John. WLP

The seasoning rub was great. Ended up using Sweet Baby Rays Sweet 'n Spicy Barbecue Sauce and I think it complimented the spice rub really well. The technique for cooking the ribs was spot on and they came out perfectly cooked.
My first time ever cooking ribs ! I can’t wait to have my family try them
This will be my go to recipe from now on. It was even tastier the next day. Make sure you WEAR GLOVES when you’re applying the rub to the ribs.
Too much chili

My go-to ribs. The ribs always come out moist, tender, and super tasty Only thing I do slightly different is I don't just prick the back of the ribs, I make sure to peel off the whole (or as much as I reasonably can) membrane. I also find that the amount of rub you make is way more than you need for one rack, but I consider that more a feature than a bug and always make at least 2 racks anyway. Oh, and I tend to try and save the liquid. Great to mix into some white rice. This recipe is why I always pounce on baby backs when on sale and try to have at least a couple of racks in my freeze.
these are great ribs

I love this recipe and I always get rave reviews from friends and family when I make it. The only additional step that I take is to brush the ribs with yellow mustard before I add the spice rub. It is a wonderful recipe and is perfect every time.
That were the best. Thank you Chef John!
Excellent recipe.
Tender and so delicious!
Cooked at 225 on convect for 4.5 hours and left in turned off oven another hour. Moved to grill and cooked over foil (after searing both sides first) for additional 20 min. basting every 10 min.
Ribs came out on the dry side. Next time I would reduce temp to 325 F for the second part and perhaps only 45 mins. Plus some of the fatty juice should be retained for basting the ribs I think.

Great cooking method for ribs (slow cook wrapped in foil followed by higher temp cooking with sauce), but needs some tweaking- more initial cooking and less rub. I used 1/3 cup each of chili powder, white sugar, and brown sugar (to lessen the chili flavor), plus the other spices for the rub. I cut my ribs into pieces with 4-5 bones, used about 2-3 T per piece to thoroughly coat then wrapped each piece individually to bake. This made it more manageable. I cooked them for just over 2 hours and they were good but they would have been just perfect with a 2.5 hour low bake. Once sauced and further cooked, the rub was overpowering the sauce, so next time I will use less rub.

Chef John - you are always my “go-to” guy! Even though it was Independence Day, i could not prepare ribs on the grill as I was cooking for 14 people and my grill is not that large! But my double ovens worked great. I prepared the ribs EXACTLY as you described and they were amazing! My family declared me a genius! Thank you Chef John for always making it easy and terrific!
These came out great!
Awesome thank you! My family loved it

I baked this in an electric roaster, followed the directions for how to bake it, and it turned out great! I only used half of the dry rub, and it was plenty on a 3-lb. rack of ribs. Next time, I will make only half the dry rub, and then half the chili powder for that amount. It was a little overpowering. Otherwise, very good!

I've made this recipe many times and love it every time. The rib rub seems enough to cover 3 racks of ribs but I keep it in a glass jar for the next time or use it on other things like bacon wrapped pork medallions.
Turned out well! Thanks!
Fall off the bones, juicy and tender. Amazing flavors.
Wife loved it. It's quick and easy, and really really good.
Super easy and really good. My son told me these were the best ribs I have ever made!
Really really good. Takes a long time but worth it. Dog stole half the rack.
Excellent method! Tender and nicely cooked. I didn't care for the rub. I like sweet ribs and these were spicy. I like hot foods, just not ribs. Next time I'll use a different rub.

I would not use this recipe again. First of all the ribs were not even close to tender after 2 hours in the oven. I had to bake them 4 and bump the temp up. We finished them on the grill, they were not as good as my original method using a dry rub, put ribs in baking dish with a enough beer to cover the bottom of the pan, cover tightly with foil and bake at 275 for 4 hours, finish with BBQ sauce either on the grill or in the oven.
I've made it several times just as it is.
I couldn’t be more happy! I can’t take spicy so I swapped out a couple spices. Restaurant quality if you ask me.
Best recipe, my go to every time. Fall off bone delicious. People argue about placing meat side down, but it makes sense and it’s what you do! You can use this recipe with frozen ribs too!
It's a great recipe, but I use about one-fourth (25%) of everything here except the actual ribs. Way less of everything that goes into the rub, way less of the barbecue sauce. Then it's perfect!

I have made a lot of ribs in my cooking endeavors. I have to say that these are the best! I get a lot of compliments from friends on how these are the tastiest ribs that they have ever had. Sometimes I just throw on Ray’s BBQ sauce and it’s a great shortcut if you are in a hurry.

This ribs are perfect EVERYTIME. I've made them about 3 times now and as I'm writing this am making them a fourth time. They aren't fall of the bone but I like them that way. I absolutely LOVE how spicy they are. They're delicious but my family thinks they're too spicy. (But that just means more for me . If you love spicy bbq then these are your ribs.
I had not made ribs before. These came out delish. The only thing I might change is to put the rub on both sides cause it was yummy!
This is my husband's favorite recipie. He will never eat ribs another way he says! I had dinner guests and made this and they were a huge hit as well!
Great recipe, easy and delish. I agree w some of the other reviews that the recipe called for way too much Chile powder. That’s an easy adjustment.

It was simple and great instructions, they tasted and look like Chef John's video.
I recommended these ribs, it was my first time making ribs and my family loved it.
These were Waaaaaaay too salty. Sorry John, you are my go to guy. Meat was perfect in texture, but I woke up with cotton mouth from 1/4 cup of salt. Is that a misprint?
This recipe was so easy and made the meat so tender, just follow the directions and you will be a chef with your family
Great method and the ribs were excellent. I did scale back the amount of chilli so it didn’t overpower the other flavours. I’ll be making these again!

These were the MOST TENDER fall off the bone ribs! Juicy not dry! Delicious! I could not believe I made these. Truly the best ever recipe I have found for ribs! Used my own seasonings - but followed cooking instructions.
Perfect Ribs EVERY TIME.
Recipe works great exactly how it’s written.
Customize rub
These are the best instructions I was kind of scared but I followed step by step and them ribs were delicious ?? thank you
Loved this rib recipe. I used my own rub and barbecue sauce. Ribs were very juicy and delicious. Thank you Chef John.
Mmmmm
I used Grill Mates Sweet & Smoky and Sweet Baby Rays. Fall off the bone goodness!
Fantastic. Best I've made yet. I used Trader Joes BBQ sauce. Will make again and again.

Great recipe! This was my first attempt at ribs so I had a small 3 pound rack of baby back ribs. I didn’t have the ground ancho peppers so I used regular ground chili peppers. I had to substitute red pepper flakes for the chipotle pepper too. I had way too much rub and I layered it on really thick. I then baked at 250 for 2 1/2 hours and finished at 350 per instructions. I used hickory BBQ sauce. The ribs are fantastic! Falling off the bone, delicious and juicy. I thought they might be too spicy but they were perfect!

Great recipe! This was my first attempt at ribs so I had a small 3 pound rack of baby back ribs. I didn’t have the ground ancho peppers so I used regular ground chili peppers. I had to substitute red pepper flakes for the chipotle pepper too. I had way too much rub and I layered it on really thick. I then baked at 250 for 2 1/2 hours and finished at 350 per instructions. I used hickory BBQ sauce. The ribs are fantastic! Falling off the bone, delicious and juicy. I thought they might be too spicy but they were perfect!

Okay Chef John.. A little heavy on the heat and salt, but tasty.
Try this... Marinate the ribs in homemade chicken broth, with lots of garlic. Marinate overnight turning a few times. Be sure to add a comfortable amount of salt and pepper. Remove and pat dry.
Put your own BBQ sauce recipe together easing up on the hot stuff and salt. Bake or BBQ.
The meat will have enormous flavor, you'll see! And by the way no chicken flavor!
Put in half the salt. Sooo good!
I only changed it to a Keto recipe using sugar substitute and sugar free BBQ sauce. Delicious.

My husband and I really love these ribs. I only made one adjustment - I scraped off the excess Ancho Chili Rub before basting with BBQ sauce, otherwise I think it would have over powered the taste. For the BBQ sauce I used a recipe also on allrecipes.com called “A Very Popular BBQ Sauce”. These two recipes are perfect together. Will definitely make it again! It’s a keeper!!!

Used the chili lime rub from Weber and TX style bbq sauce this time...learned this method as a kid using salt pepper and garlic with homemade barbecue sauce. Best fallen off the rib, candied perfectly ribs you can do without an actual bbq! Chilled and brought to buddies bbq for warming and serving!
I didn't have the ancho but it was incredible! Delicious and the meat fell off the bones.
Usually love chef John’s recipes, but this one had far too much chili flavor for my taste.
Amazing ribs! My wife loved them and now we’re having them again!!!

Since I had my own rub, this review is mostly for the baking technique. This is spot on. The ribs were perfectly baked. Very tender, moist and delicious. Thank you Chef John, you have never failed me!
Excellent

I really wanted to like this, but it was way to much salt and chili powder. Another thing leaving it in the oven at 350* for 50 more minutes, basting every ten minutes, was absolutely way to long, it dried my ribs out.

Fantastic!! I wasn’t sure this could possibly be as good as bbq but it was darn close. I used just a touch of liquid smoke and you would swear you were eating from the grill. I followed the recipe exactly (except for the liquid smoke) and it was delicious! I would have included a picture but not one of the three racks made it to the table.

The ribs were very tender and moist. However, even though I cut back on the amount of chili powder and cayenne pepper, it was still pretty spicy and too salty for our taste. I would make it again, adjusting those 3 quantities.
Fabulous presentation and great taste.
The rub was quick and easy. My husband loved the flavor. These ribs were a hit in my house.

This is my families go to when it comes to ribs. They come out perfect every time. After trying many rubs store bought and home made we have found that our favorite rub is Billy Bones Competition Rub. These ribs are like candy on the bone. You won't be disappointed.

I'm a big fan of BBQ, not so much a fan of cooking it myself. I just don't enjoy standing in front of a hot grill, especially in July and August here in Fabulous Las Vegas. After using a number of crockpot recipes with mushy soupy results I'm so pleased to find this recipe. As far as I'm concerened these ribs are the best. Bubbye, Charbroil!
Great recipe. Mostly I followed procedure.
